intro: Antherotoma antherotoma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of climates. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban settings.
